articles.title: Bosch unveils AI extension platform for smart cockpits at CES 2026
articles.description: Bosch will unveil its AI extension platform at CES 2026 in Las Vegas to equip vehicles with an AI-powered cockpit that learns drivers’ routines, preferences, and context through a high-performance computing unit upgrade. The automotive industry integrates software and artificial intelligence as core elements of driving and in-cabin experiences. Bosch advances this integration by developing […]

articles.title: AI agent-driven browser automation for enterprise workflow management
articles.description: Enterprise organizations increasingly rely on web-based applications for critical business processes, yet many workflows remain manually intensive, creating operational inefficiencies and compliance risks. Despite significant technology investments, knowledge workers routinely navigate between eight to twelve different web applications during standard workflows, constantly switching contexts and manually transferring information between systems. Data entry and validation tasks […]

articles.title: How Cloudflare’s tokio-quiche Makes QUIC and HTTP/3 a First Class Citizen in Rust Backends
articles.description: Cloudflare has open sourced tokio-quiche, an asynchronous QUIC and HTTP/3 Rust library that wraps its battle tested quiche implementation with the Tokio runtime. The library has been refined inside production systems such as Apple iCloud Private Relay, next generation Oxy based proxies and WARP’s MASQUE client, where it handles millions of HTTP/3 requests per second […] The post How Cloudflare’s tokio-quiche Makes QUIC and HTTP/3 a First Class Citizen in Rust Backends appeared first on...

articles.title: CES 2026: New Galaxy features aim to spot dementia symptoms early
articles.description: Samsung announced at its CES 2026 First Look event that Galaxy wearables will detect early signs of dementia through tracking changes in speech, movement, and daily activity, aiming to provide early warnings for users and families to seek medical care, with beta rollout in select markets. The company concluded its First Look event at CES […]

articles.title: Exploring the zero operator access design of Mantle
articles.description: In this post, we explore how Mantle, Amazon's next-generation inference engine for Amazon Bedrock, implements a zero operator access (ZOA) design that eliminates any technical means for AWS operators to access customer data.
articles.author: Anthony Liguori
articles.content: In this post, we explore how Mantle, Amazon's next-generation inference engine for Amazon Bedrock, implements a zero operator access (ZOA) design that eliminates any technical means for AWS operators to access customer data.

articles.title: JBL reimagines open-ear listening with new Sense series at CES 2026
articles.description: At CES 2026 in Las Vegas on January 5, 2026, JBL announced the JBL Sense Pro and JBL Sense Lite open-ear earbuds, which use JBL OpenSound air-conduction technology to deliver high-quality audio while keeping ear canals open for ambient sound awareness. JBL positions these earbuds as a reimagined open-ear headphone lineup. The JBL OpenSound air-conduction […]

articles.title: A regime change in Venezuela could have grim consequences for Canada’s oil sector
articles.description: Canada and Venezuela compete in the same heavy-oil regional and global markets, so shifts in supply from Canada to Venezuela would widely reverberate across the Canadian economy.
articles.author: Philippe Le Billon, Professor, Geography Department and School of Public Policy & Global Affairs, University of British Columbia
articles.content: Canada and Venezuela compete in the same heavy-oil regional and global markets, so shifts in supply from Canada to Venezuela would widely reverberate across the Canadian economy.

articles.title: How to Build a Production-Ready Multi-Agent Incident Response System Using OpenAI Swarm and Tool-Augmented Agents
articles.description: In this tutorial, we build an advanced yet practical multi-agent system using OpenAI Swarm that runs in Colab. We demonstrate how we can orchestrate specialized agents, such as a triage agent, an SRE agent, a communications agent, and a critic, to collaboratively handle a real-world production incident scenario. articles.title: Kargo closes on $42M funding round to automate loading dock and warehouse operations
articles.description: Freight shipping artificial intelligence startup Kargo Inc. said Tuesday it has closed on $42 million in new funding in order to scale up deployments of its smart loading dock and warehouse technology. articles.title: Faster agents, bigger blast radius: Why agent governance is the new control plane for resilience
articles.description: As enterprises accelerate their move toward autonomous workflows powered by artificial intelligence, the urgent need for robust AI agent governance has become a critical operational mandate. An agent’s potential relies on the fact that they can perform higher-level tasks, including assuming identities and executing business processes.
